content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    pattern = r"\```julia[\s\S]+?\```\n?"  # regex pattern for Julia code blocks
    matches = matchall(pattern, md)  # extract all matches
    julia_code = join(removeprefix(matches, "```julia\n")), "\n")  # remove code fences and join the code blocks
    return julia_code
end
```

This function extracts all Julia code blocks from a markdown document `md`. It first defines a regular expression pattern to match the Julia code blocks. Then it uses `matchall` to extract all matches.

The function then removes the code fence (````julia\n`) using the `removeprefix` function, and joins the resulting code blocks together with newlines using `join`.

Finally, the function returns the extracted Julia code as a String.
